intro: Junellia hayekii, commonly known as the Hayek's junellia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, Junellia hayekii is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
